name.value: FHIR Connectathon 15 - Patient - Formal Testing - FHIR Server - Delete - Client Assigned Resource Id - XML

description.value: Patient Track - Formal Testing - test FHIR Server using the XML format to delete Patient resource instance. The test setup creates a new Patient resource where the client assigns the resource id. The destination server must support the conditional create using the update (PUT) operation, read, search and delete operations to insure the Patient resource does not exist or is removed prior to test execution.
Delete, Create, Read and Search Operations
System-generated search and delete operations from conditional delete to insure the patient does not exist on the server.
Create the Patient resource in XML format on the destination server for subsequent testing of the delete operation.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK) or 201(Created).

Test the delete operation of a known valid resource instance. The expected response is 200 (OK) when content is returned; e.g. OperationOutcome, or 204 (No Content) when the content is empty. Subsequent read and search operations are executed to confirm the deleted resource is not returned.
Patient delete operation of a known valid resource instance.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK) or 204(No Content).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type is not present. Warning only as the server may set this header by default.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header ETag is present. Warning only as the server may not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Last-Modified is not present. Warning only to allow subsequent asserts to execute.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Location is not present. Warning only to allow subsequent asserts to execute.

Read the deleted Patient and verify the response is 410 (Gone) or 404 (Not Found) for servers that do not support versioning. The Accept header JSON format is defined for an optionally returned OperationOutcome resource.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 404(Not Found) or 410(Gone).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains the FHIR mime-type 'application/fhir+xml'. Warning only as a response content is optional but servers are encouraged to return this.
Confirm that the returned resource type is OperationOutcome. Warning only as this is optional but servers are encouraged to return an OperationOutcome for any additional information.
Search for the deleted Patient by the unique identifier and verify that no matching resource instances are found.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains the FHIR mime-type 'application/fhir+xml'.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Bundle.
Confirm that there are no records returned.
Confirm that no entries exist in the Bundle
